CI related question
how to set the Java_8 for CI in gradle
and to allow java 7 as default
<@U0XCFE6AH>: What do you mean?
in gradle it’s something like this: org.gradle.java.home=$JAVA7_HOME
to set it just for gradle
and the system default would be whatever your JAVA_HOME env variable is
yup.. changed it
thanks
also deamon = true and deamon =false
whats benefit for CI
if you’re running several tasks in a succession
then daemon=true could save you a few seconds
otherwise no
but it can’t hurt.
oh when you have gradle properties - it will go from top level (systemwide) down to project and to module, more specific will take preference
ok
i thought setting it false will be faster
imo the performance hit is just seconds
ok

guys any ideas why my getView gets called multiple times? I have tried the suggestions in stackoverflow by setting layout_height=“match_parent” in my ListView but not luck

here is my fragment: ```<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<RelativeLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    tools:context="com.example.android.booklist.MainActivity"
    >

    <EditText
        android:id="@+id/book_name"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:layout_marginLeft="16dp"
        android:layout_marginTop="8dp"
        android:ems="14"
        android:hint="Enter Book Name" />

    <Button
        android:id="@+id/search_books"
        android:layout_width="52dp"
        android:layout_height="40dp"
        android:layout_alignParentEnd="true"
        android:layout_alignParentRight="true"
        android:layout_alignParentTop="true"
        android:layout_marginRight="16dp"
        android:layout_marginTop="8dp"
        android:background="@drawable/ic_search_black_48dp"
        android:focusable="true"
        android:onClick="fetchBooksData" />

    <ListView
        android:id="@+id/list_books"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="fill_parent"
        android:layout_below="@id/enter_book_name"
        android:layout_marginTop="8dp"
        android:drawSelectorOnTop="true"
        android:dropDownHeight="match_parent"
        android:orientation="vertical">
    </ListView>
</RelativeLayout>```
<@U1FECKXA9>: it’s an adapter, `getView` should be called multiple times by design
as soon as a new row is displayed on the screen, `getView` will be called
why is it an issue?

<@U1FECKXA9|droidace> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/droidace/F1SQXLRV3/screen_shot_2016-07-18_at_20.51.00.png|i thought it is the root cause of this issue. you see No results found displayed twice>

text: <@U0B6XQJ2F>: because I thought it is the root cause for the above issue
is “No results found” a `Book`?
I think that `ArrayList<Book>` contains 2 “No results found” items. where are you adding it?
in a listview
yes its a book
<@U0B6XQJ2F>:
well, I’m pretty sure you are adding 2 of them in the ArrayList

<@U0B6XQJ2F>:  Im using asyntask then in my onpostexecute I have this: ```
        @Override
        protected void onPostExecute(ArrayList<Book> books) {
            Log.v("onPostExecute2", books.get(0).toString());
            if (books != null) {
               // adapter.clear();
                for (int p = 0; p < books.size(); p++) {
                   Log.v("postonexecute of books", books.get(p).toString());
                }
                adapter.addAll(books);
            }
        }```
this seems fine
let’s make sure that the ArrayList contains 2 elements as I think
either use a debugger or add a log statement in the adapter’s constructor
to display the list’s size
oh wait, I think I know where the problem lies
<@U1FECKXA9>: if you continue typing in the EditText, does the list grow?
or when you search
when i search strings that dont exist this happens
you are doing `adapter.addAll(books)`
it already contains a “No results” element
and you are adding another one
and then another one
you should clear the adapter before doing `addAll`
hmmn
in the above i already have the clear commented out
if i uncomment it i get the same problem
adapter.clear
this issue only happens when i serachh for strings that dont exist in google books
but if the string exist my lisst dont show any duplicates
I’m pretty sure `clear` should fix the issue
let me try one more time
put adapter.clear but now my getView() does not even get called
